medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, an ___ year old female, awakened at 5 AM with epigastric pain, which she initially believed to be similar to her past ___ flares. The pain was described as usually left-sided during her previous flares, not epigastric. She experienced nausea and vomiting (3 episodes at home, 5 in the ED - 'clear,' nonbilious, nonbloody), along with chills and no fevers.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cerebral palsy, chol lithiasis, gastroesophageal reflux, hypothyroidism, osteopenia, osteoporosis, vitamin D deficiency, asthma
medical_history.family_history: Cousin with ___ disease on anti-TNF, sister with late ___ undiagnosed recurrent N/V/D, mother with bipolar disorder and alcoholism
